body:
# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849?src=pr&el=h1) Report
> Merging [#3849](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/commit/5c7ecbbf4c7a8fc5cb7b01b5db17aab78bd79b86?src=pr&el=desc) will **decrease** coverage by `<.01%`.
> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=WdLKlKHOAU&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff             @@
##           master    #3849      +/-   ##
==========================================
- Coverage   77.43%   77.43%   -0.01%     
==========================================
  Files         203      203              
  Lines       15882    15850      -32     
==========================================
- Hits        12299    12274      -25     
+ Misses       3583     3576       -7
```


| [Impacted Files](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849?src=pr&el=tree) | Coverage Δ | |
|---|---|---|
| [airflow/models.py](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-YWlyZmxvdy9tb2RlbHMucHk=) | `88.76% <100%> (+0.01%)` | :arrow_up: |
| [airflow/bin/cli.py](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3849/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-YWlyZmxvdy9iaW4vY2xpLnB5) | `64.78% <0%> (-0.7%)` | :arrow_down: |

Merge conflicts should now be resolved.

On Wed, Sep 5, 2018 at 8:35 AM Fokko Driesprong <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Still some merge conflicts :( @wmorris75 <https://github.com/wmorris75>
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3828#issuecomment-418713995>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHlcZv7h5FYFqV6Uu2RPMtR42q3UA0hhks5uX8UagaJpZM4WVczQ>
> .
>


-- 
With kind regards,
Wayne Morris
LGTM but can you please Squash commits ?
@Fokko They will need to copy/paste this DAG into their `DAGs` directory similar to how they can use any other example dag under `contrib/example_dags`

Thanks @dgingrich for the PR. Do you think it is possible to test this?

Recently we've moved to Docker for the testing. Therefore we have a Postgres instance available in a linked container.
@Fokko @r39132 I am able to pass CI and please consider merging and I will pick up `[AIRFLOW-2929]` and work on it this week.
Thanks @ChengzhiZhao Merging!
@Fokko I didn't submit the PR or the bug, I think you want @rlkelly
@ChengzhiZhao Something looks wrong. I see 51 commits in the PR, can you fix this?
cc @feng-tao  / @artwr / @yrqls21 or @aoen y'all seem to have worked on the related files recently if any of you have a chance to review I'd appreciate it :)
Sorry about this, had some work stuff happen but got more cycles for airlfow again, I'll update this now.

@Fokko Yes, it looks like a bad rebase -- he is recommitting older commits. 

@ChengzhiZhao Please retry.
@ashb Thx for this. LGTM.
The more I look at this the less sense it makes, requiring tox shouldn't cause these sorts of failures.
@Fokko @r39132 my bad about the previous rebase, I fixed it and appreciate your time to review again.
Is it possible to host this image at https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow-ci?

Then we would need a different repo per image to do this nicely. Since this is not really tied to Airflow, I would not host everything under the Apache organisation, otherwise we will need to create a lot of repositories :(
Sqlite does not allow the modification of columns, so the build for them will fail. Is there a common workaround for this?

Seeing a few [`Lost connection to MySQL server during query errors`](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/jobs/424719049#L5596) within the CI but cannot repro locally. Closing this PR for now and will try debug on another PR using my travis to avoid consuming too much open source travis resources.
LGTM, but let's wait for couples of days and see if others have the chance to review / run it.
@feng-tao Definitely. Thank you very much!
I could improve the test coverage on this if this is something you'd be interested in using
Ok. Merging this. @ChengzhiZhao please take on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2929 to address the gap.
@bolkedebruin / @Fokko Do you have further feedback?
@kaxil How did you discover and fix most of these? Are you using some sort of auto-linter?
@kaxil A google cloud helper bucket test is failing..

I believe this was never merged, except via another PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3572

@verdan https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2691 links to both this and the other PR. Can you please clean up the JIRA to point to the PR that was merged?
@verdan are you planning on updating the release process page now that 1.10.0 is out?
LGTM, thanks for the PR again!
LGTM, thanks.
LGTM @holdenk , thanks for the fix. Could you close your jira once the pr is merged?
The failures do look totally unrelated to Tox or not. Given we have dockeriszed the CI and test pipelines do we need even tox anymore?
@ashb I'm working on removing tox, but removing tox this isn't trivial. Since we already encapsulate the tests in Docker, tox adds another layer of abstraction, which is not required in my opinion.

It looks like SQLite doesn't actually enforce the max length on the columns:

```
sqlite> insert into connection (password) values('aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa...a');
sqlite> select id, length(password) from connection;
1|1
2|1900
```

So maybe the fix is to simply not run this migration on sqlite engines? I'm some what surprised that the tests we added in #3516 didn't catch this (as the model already has the length set at 5000 but we were missing a migration to change it. (Which is nothing to do with this PR).
Let's not pull this in to 1.10.1 -- it very much doesn't fall in the the category of "bug fix or small features"
Just notices that this test wasn't failing even though `_password` field on Connection had a length of 5000 in the model but only 500 in the migrations. Any idea why that might be?

@r39132 Unfortunately it was a long manual process :( .  I was scrolling pages (took couple of hours) at https://airflow.apache.org/code.html and https://airflow.apache.org/integration.html to see if everything is formatted properly or something is missed. 

Our documentation still needs some love.
@r39132 I have also updated the PR, so should fix Travis :)

@r39132 this one was closed in favor of the #3572 
I've fixed the Jira issue and unlink this PR.

@r39132 I don't have access to update the release process page. I believe once this change will go live, then we'll need to update the release process page. If this is going to be released in the next release, then sure we need to update the release page.
Welcome aboard @andrewsardone @dadrian @zakird
With the exception of the `striing-->str` conversion that will be handled in a separate PR, this looks good to go.

@verdan You do now - CWIKI perms granted :-) 

Do you mean that you will wait until we retire the old UI before updating the release process? Isn't the rbac UI available already in the pypi releases? Kindly clarify? I believe the current process could be altered because rbac is already bundled with it with our releases.
@jlowin How are you? What do you want to do with this PR?
@jlowin  What do you want to do with this PR?
There should be a docstring checker, like flake8 for the code style 🤔
@sdebarshi @dmitrig01 Welcome aboard!
hehe.. just under a 100 files.. :-)
I have updated PR, thanks! And I will reopen the PR after write new alemic script.
Hi @ashb , a gentle ping. May you take another look? Thanks.

Good catch @XD-DENG . Wonder how long this issue went un-noticed. We have this issue in **1.9.0**, **1.8.2**  docs as well:

1.9.0: https://airflow.readthedocs.io/en/1.9.0/cli.html#Named%20Arguments_repeat4
1.8.2: https://airflow-fork-k1.readthedocs.io/en/v1-8-stable/cli.html#Named%20Arguments_repeat1

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8811558/45214222-c6327e00-b291-11e8-8a8f-15bd65137d6e.png)

I fear we had this Bug since the start.

@ashb you are right, changing this will cause issues. I will create a new PR to take care of this.

Thanks @kaxil for the further checking.

I'll close this PR then. Regarding **issue 2** (a missing space), may you fix that in your new PR as well? Thanks!
Thanks @chronitis for the PR. Thanks @tswast @kaxil for reviewing!
Add @Fokko and @r39132 to address the gap of [AIRFLOW-2882]
@ckljohn Any idea where this extra newline is being created? I'd rather remove the source of the extra newline than strip it afterwards. This feels like a hack.
Is the `from airflow.api.common.experimental import pool` still used? We try to unload code from the `models.py` since this file is huge :)
I have resolved the outstanding conflicts and awaiting feedback.
@zeninpalm Would it be possible to test this?
@dimberman PTAL :)

@Fokko I can't approve anything involving the k8s executor because @gerardo's PR for dockerized CI broke the k8s tests s.t. they revert to the non-k8s tests (if you look at the CI you'll see that the k8s tests aren't actually launching a cluster). I've been trying to figure out how to get the k8s tests to work but for some reason the docker-compose stuff has broken the ability to correctly use minikube.

PTAL at this https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3797. I managed to get most of the way with switching to the dind k8s cluster, but still need to figure out how to use the airflow API Since we can't use `minikube ip` anymore.

@XD-DENG friendly ping!
Thanks @r39132 ! I'm working on fixing CI now ;-) Possibly can re-push by the end of today (latest by tomorrow end).

@gsakkis Firstly, thanks for taking this on. It's been a while and the project has improved a lot since this time. If you'd like to reopen this PR, we will take an earnest look at it with a plan to merge quickly. I will close this PR for now and the associated JIRA. Pls reopen if you would like to revisit this work.
@dispower  the output (to the file) should not contain the logs of the cli, it defeats the purpose (to get a working config file). Not sure how to handle that though.

Thanks @ashb for pointing out,  I've changed the commit title and PR title to `Parallelize Celery Executor task state fetching` to better reflect the content of the change. Also open for discussion on the default value of `sync_parallelism`( given the small difference different value can cause let's keep it short). I vote for `16`, it has proven to provide great performance, ~1s running time for querying 30k running task states( of course this also heavily depends on the network, celery broker, backend etc, we use redis for broker and backend), and is not a crazy number that will create much burden on the box.

You are changing the docs for master where this change has happened. In addition it is marked under master in the updating documentation.
Can you give an example when you want to use this? The config is likely to contain secrets, so we should be careful exposing this.

@Fokko my initial use was to:
- create a container that was setup with environment variables (including some in the entrypoint.sh, as in https://github.com/puckel/docker-airflow) and no custom configuration.
- generate the config file to persist it so that when executing commands in the container, airflow CLI would work without having to setup all the environment variables needed

The problem being that the CLI (and I suppose other daemons) needs some of the same environment variables than the running webserver.

My current workaround is to run commands through `entrypoint.sh`, which sets up all the needed environment variables. This works as long as the entrypoint script is not making mutations to the filesystem.

Maybe the original issue wasn't the correct way to tackle this problem though... I will leave that decision to the airflow team :)

Thanks @victornoel 

This won't fix the problem, since the original configuration file will be read, and the environment variables are ignored. Then you should generate a config using the configuration class: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/airflow/configuration.py

This isn't trivial though since you will need to iterate over all the environment variables, and populate the keys in the conf file, while keeping the order into account (environment variables have priority over the config file).

@Fokko thanks for clarifying this: basically what you just described is the original requirement of the jira issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3011

So the PR does not solve the opened issue at all @dispower :)

Hi @r39132 , I have refined the implementation for this `next_execution` CLI. 

**Implementation**
- It can handle different schedule_interval (Cron, timedelta, `None`, preset including "@once")
- For `None` or `@once` schedule_interval, it will return `None` as result
- If there is no `latest_execution_date` found, it prints a reminder ("Only applicable when there is execution record found") and returns `None` as result.
- It will print a reminder if the DAG is paused at that moment.

**Tests**
Test cases has been added based on four example DAG files
- 'example_bash_operator' (schedule_interval is `'0 0 * * *'`)
- 'latest_only' (schedule_interval is `timedelta(hours=4)`)
- 'example_python_operator' (schedule_interval=`None`)
- 'example_xcom' (schedule_interval="`@once`")

This helps us cover different scenarios.

Please take another look. Many thanks.

Thx @Fokko. I will merge this now.

* adhoc.png
* chart.png
* chart_form.png

However, I need to get them up and working first on some reasonable data. I'll do those in a follow-up PR.
